title: Cleveland police have 'person of interest' after woman is killed on East Side
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Cleveland police have identified a "person of interest" in an East Side shooting that claimed the life of one woman and critically injured a teenager, police said.
An officer at the scene would not say who police are searching for, or his connection to the 1 p.m. shooting that left a 60-year-old woman dead and another injured. No arrests have been made.
The shooting happened in the 13400 block of Crennell Avenue in the city's Corlett neighborhood, police said. Officers arrived to find the woman, who has not been identified, dead in the home.
A 17-year-old boy was critically injured in the shooting and taken to University Hospitals, Cleveland EMS said.
The residential street where the shooting happened remained blocked off with police tape by about 3:45 p.m.
Officers were seen coming and going from the two-story, multi-unit brick building where the shooting took place. Officials wheeled a stretcher up to the residence about 3:40 p.m.
Some neighbors gathered to watch police activity at the home, while others continued shoveling their driveways. One resident expressed shock, and said the neighborhood is generally a quiet one.
To comment on this, please visit Thursday's crime and courts comments page.
